of the National Museum of American History on Tuesday, the same day Barack Obama Hu Jintao visited the White House, Sen. Bernie Sanders wrote that he was particularly disappointed that the miniature statues of presidents were made in China. It appears that a museum owned by the people of the United States, celebrating the history of the United States, can not find companies in this country employing American workers that are able to manufacture statues of our founding fathers, or our current president, Sen. Bernie Sanders wrote. "That is pretty pathetic! I was not aware that the collapse of our manufacturing base had gone that far." Sen. Bernie Sanders wants all the products to be made by American companies.

Andy Coulson was editor of the Rupert Murdoch-owned News of The World in 2006, when the paper"s royal editor, Clive Goodman , was arrested for hacking into voicemails belonging to Princes David Cameron and Harry.
